intro: Francfleurya honbaensis, commonly known as the Honbaensis francfleurya, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
